column4: is there any way to access the C:// drive on a dual boot while in Ubuntu?
I can't seem to find it
linux doesn't identify the drive as C:
what would it be calles
at the command line type: df
I don't know what I'm looking at sry
under Filesystem it should say something along the lined of /dev/sda1
yeah, dev/sda5 and sda2
do you have two hard drives?
just one
ok, what is the goal? are you trying to find a file?
I'm trying to place a file into it. so I can run fixmbr
fixmbr is a windows thing isn't it?
yes, but i'm placing the exe files into it.
I need to remove linux and keep windows, I know crazy.
it happens :)  i'm reasonably sure fixmbr can only be run from a windows recovery disk. so i'm not sure why you are asking how linux would mount the hard drive. windows does it differently.
I just need to place the files into it from linux then running it in windows
ok, what directory are you looking for?
place a file into the root drive C
on linux the 'base' directory is: /
I found the root, but I don't have the permission to see the contents. Know a way around it, if not thanks anyway.
none of that worked, I still don't have permission from the admin
